body: Do you have time for a PR?
@terabytesoftw I don't know what the fix would be, except to perhaps remove "'char" and "nchar" from the in_array.  If you think that is the fix, I can do the PR.

> [@terabytesoftw](https://github.com/terabytesoftw) I don't know what the fix would be, except to perhaps remove "'char" and "nchar" from the in_array. If you think that is the fix, I can do the PR.

You need to find out the legacy versions of Sqlsrv, which types max supports, so as not to break BC, and fix the bug.

@terabytesoftw How far back for legacy versions of Sqlserv?

Looks like the documentation, the oldest they are going back to SQL Server 2016.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/data-types/char-and-varchar-transact-sql?view=sql-server-2016
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/data-types/nchar-and-nvarchar-transact-sql?view=sql-server-2016

It would appear SQL Server 2016 did not support "MAX" for char or nchar.
@darkdef Can you take a look at this issue?  It would appear you added the code that might be part of this problem.

> [@terabytesoftw](https://github.com/terabytesoftw) How far back for legacy versions of Sqlserv?
> 
> Looks like the documentation, the oldest they are going back to SQL Server 2016. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/data-types/char-and-varchar-transact-sql?view=sql-server-2016 https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/data-types/nchar-and-nvarchar-transact-sql?view=sql-server-2016
> 
> It would appear SQL Server 2016 did not support "MAX" for char or nchar.

I've been checking and as far as i understand, both char(n) and nchar(n) use fixed values, so yes, it is correct to solve the bug.

Make the PR, and add a test, for the type behavior.
@craiglondon https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/20490 It should solve the problem, you could check it.

@terabytesoftw I guess we were working on this at the same time.   Yours is similar, but I don't think it will work because "char" and "nchar" have to a value passed to it, otherwise it defaults to 1.   Please review my PR https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/20491

issue.title: Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'nchar'

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework
